intro: Coryphopteris inopinata, commonly known as the slender tree fern, is a species native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It is a member of the family Blechnaceae and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and fronds that are typically bipinnate. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Its unique morphology makes it a distinctive feature in its natural habitat. The plant is also valued for its ornamental qualities in horticultural settings.
